pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.2: That is, four finger-breadths, _caturaṅgula_. This follows the suggestion in BMC I, pp. 565-566, that a finger-breadth is approximately two centimeters, making four such finger-breadths 8 centimeters.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.15: _Sugata-cīvara-ppamāṇaṃ_, “the robe measure of the Sugata,” that is, of the Buddha. The Sugata measures are standard measures, and I translate accordingly.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc92:1.16: That is, nine standard hand-spans (_sugata-vidatthi_) by six standard hand-spans. The metric units given here are based on the estimate of the _sugata-vidatthi_ given in BMC I, pp.565-566.
